org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core

Class CloudSim

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core.CloudSim

  • public class CloudSim
extends java.lang.Object
    This class extends the CloudSimCore to enable network simulation in CloudSim. Also, it disables all the network models from CloudSim, to provide a simpler simulation of networking. In the network model used by CloudSim, a topology file written in BRITE format is used to describe the network. Later, nodes in such file are mapped to CloudSim entities. Delay calculated from the BRITE model are added to the messages send through CloudSim. Messages using the old model are converted to the apropriate methods with the correct parameters.
    Since:
    CloudSim Toolkit 1.0
    Author:
    Rodrigo N. Calheiros, Anton Beloglazov

      • initCommonVariable

        private static void initCommonVariable(java.util.Calendar _calendar,
                                       boolean _traceFlag,
                                       int numUser)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Initialises all the common attributes.
        Parameters:
        _calendar - the _calendar
        _traceFlag - the _trace flag
        numUser - number of users
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - This happens when creating this entity before initialising CloudSim package or this entity name is null or empty

      • init

        public static void init(int numUser,
                        java.util.Calendar cal,
                        boolean traceFlag)
        Initialises CloudSim parameters. This method should be called before creating any entities.

        Inside this method, it will create the following CloudSim entities:

        • CloudInformationService.
        • CloudSimShutdown

        Parameters:
        numUser - the number of User Entities created. This parameters indicates that gridsim.CloudSimShutdown first waits for all user entities's END_OF_SIMULATION signal before issuing terminate signal to other entities
        cal - starting time for this simulation. If it is null, then the time will be taken from Calendar.getInstance()
        traceFlag - true if CloudSim trace need to be written
        See Also:
        gridsim.CloudSimShutdown, CloudInformationService.CloudInformationService

      • init

        public static void init(int numUser,
                        java.util.Calendar cal,
                        boolean traceFlag,
                        double periodBetweenEvents)
        Initialises CloudSim parameters. This method should be called before creating any entities.

        Inside this method, it will create the following CloudSim entities:

        • CloudInformationService.
        • CloudSimShutdown

        Parameters:
        numUser - the number of User Entities created. This parameters indicates that gridsim.CloudSimShutdown first waits for all user entities's END_OF_SIMULATION signal before issuing terminate signal to other entities
        cal - starting time for this simulation. If it is null, then the time will be taken from Calendar.getInstance()
        traceFlag - true if CloudSim trace need to be written
        periodBetweenEvents - - the minimal period between events. Events within shorter periods after the last event are discarded.
        See Also:
        gridsim.CloudSimShutdown, CloudInformationService.CloudInformationService

      • startSimulation

        public static double startSimulation()
                              throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Starts the execution of CloudSim simulation. It waits for complete execution of all entities, i.e. until all entities threads reach non-RUNNABLE state or there are no more events in the future event queue.

        Note: This method should be called after all the entities have been setup and added.

        Returns:
        the double
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - This happens when creating this entity before initialising CloudSim package or this entity name is null or empty.
        See Also:
        gridsim.CloudSim#init(int, Calendar, boolean)

      • stopSimulation

        public static void stopSimulation()
                           throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Stops Cloud Simulation (based on Simulation#runStop()). This should be only called if any of the user defined entities explicitly want to terminate simulation during execution.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - This happens when creating this entity before initialising CloudSim package or this entity name is null or empty
        See Also:
        gridsim.CloudSim#init(int, Calendar, boolean), Simulation#runStop()

      • terminateSimulation

        public static boolean terminateSimulation()
        This method is called if one wants to terminate the simulation.
        Returns:
        true, if successful; false otherwise.

      • terminateSimulation

        public static boolean terminateSimulation(double time)
        This method is called if one wants to terminate the simulation at a given time.
        Parameters:
        time - the time at which the simulation has to be terminated
        Returns:
        true, if successful otherwise.

      • wait

        public static void wait(int src,
                        Predicate p)
        Sets an entity's state to be waiting. The predicate used to wait for an event is now passed to Sim_system. Only events that satisfy the predicate will be passed to the entity. This is done to avoid unnecessary context switches.
        Parameters:
        src - the src
        p - the p

                          Predicate p)

        p - the p
        Returns:
        the int

        Returns:
        if the simulation has been restarted or or otherwise.

      • run

        public static double run()
        Start the simulation running. This should be called after all the entities have been setup and added, and their ports linked.
        Returns:
        the double last clock value

      • finishSimulation

        public static void finishSimulation()
        Internal method that allows the entities to terminate. This method should not be used in user simulations.
